TopicTitle: The Rocket Printing Hype Train Thread

Articles.Content:
I bet Maxmaps is laughing his face off at all the speculation.. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Which is why I don't speculate, that time could be better spent, you know, *like playing the game.* Too easy to speculate a partnership with "OMG SpaceX NASA ESA and the government of mars combined!" and be disappointed when "Er, it's a partnership with a hot dog stand. *We're adding food.*"

I feel like something with ESA is likely, since ESA logos were added in .90 without any ESA parts or new missions. The partnership with ESA could be like the one with NASA for .23.5. Seems like ESA would be down for an AMA, especially if the tie-in is Rosetta/Philae related.

> 
> and be disappointed when "Er, it's a partnership with a hot dog stand. *We're adding food.*"

I wouldn't be too disappointed by that, I've wanted life support for a long time. Unless it's got brand names plastered all over the parts ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

> 
> I wouldn't be too disappointed by that, I've wanted life support for a long time. Unless it's got brand names plastered all over the parts ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Well, I meant something minor, and food happened to be the first thing that popped in my head..

Life support would be awesome though ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

> 
> Outsourced multiplayer? ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)

Now that's an interesting idea. *Provided it does not affect single-player play at all* I could get behind a big name being involved in the multiplayer side of things. After all, we know that Squad's own servers struggle sometimes (ie when a new update is released).

> 
> I wouldn't be too disappointed by that, I've wanted life support for a long time. Unless it's got brand names plastered all over the parts ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

announcing the new oscar-mayer brand HD-100 life support capsule! (HD= hotdogs)

Hopefully its a SpaceX pack with a reworked loading distance so we can actually land our spent stages and put things into orbit at the same time. This would be common practice if it weren't for that 2.5km load distance.
Perhaps the partnership is with either Boeing or Space Xand we will be getting a new capsule based on one of the CCtCap designs. Would coincide with adding an additional named Kerbal.

> 
> Will post a little something on the subreddit tomorrow about a cool partnership we got. Taking some stuff to a different dimension.

l'me guess. Fredrick of Hollywood Haut Culture Space Suits for the newest Nauts?

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> It's confirmed.
> [http://fc00.deviantart.net/fs71/i/2012/150/9/e/concept_craft__6___minecraft_space_program_by_thrustwolf-d51mcto.jpg](http://fc00.deviantart.net/fs71/i/2012/150/9/e/concept_craft__6___minecraft_space_program_by_thrustwolf-d51mcto.jpg)
> 
> They've partnered with Mojang.
> 
> Prepare for **war**.

THE BORG HAVE RETURNED!

> 
> It's confirmed.
> http://thrustwolf.deviantart.com/art/Concept-Craft-6-Minecraft-Space-Program-305053548[http://fc00.deviantart.net/fs71/i/2012/150/9/e/concept_craft__6___minecraft_space_program_by_thrustwolf-d51mcto.jpg](http://fc00.deviantart.net/fs71/i/2012/150/9/e/concept_craft__6___minecraft_space_program_by_thrustwolf-d51mcto.jpg)
> 
> They've partnered with Mojang.
> 
> Prepare for **war**.

Already being done. [Planets-Cubed](https://www.planets-cube.com)

"A new Dimension...of Social media updates! We'll now be posting exclusive tidbits about the 1.0 release on our myspace page!" :3

Tired jokes aside, parts inspired by other space agencies would be nice.

I can't believe anyone hasn't said this yet, but KSP themed fireworks. Actual rocket explosives that actually fly and explode, designed after the parts you all know and love (to make explode in game). Three sizes! Duct tape them together in stacks, radially, with actual asparagus, whatever! Yell out MOAR BOOSTERS over and over until it no longer becomes funny (edit: it never becomes not funny) as you wake everyone who lives within a kilometer with a KSP themed explosion!

Obviously it is a SpaceX partnership. Squad will add an in game option to convert .craft files into blueprints, and email them to the SpaceX workshops where they will build them for real.

350,000,000 USD per craft. Launchpad rental not included.
Is it gonna be a partnership with Orbital? They're well versed in the kerbal way as of their last launch attempt.

![GXaKFci.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/GXaKFci.jpg)

So now I'm thinking something more like the NASA pack.

Probably ESA, but I'd also like some Space X love.
All I can say is "Wow, this hypetrain is gonna be HUGE!"

> 
> All I can say is "Wow, this hypetrain is gonna be HUGE!"

Oh god, no. ![-_-](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_sleep.png)
They probably won't say anything about it tonight. I would like ESA or SpaceX parts, Rosseta/Philae with comets would be cool.
I wonder if this has anything to do with the secret feature that's been talked about. Unless they've specifically said no it could be a possibility.
Third guess is a instant replay feature or rewind warp.
If we're finding out today, we should find out in about 20 minutes, that seems to be the usual time for posting weekly updates.
What about that "toy" survey they had a while back? Could it be related to that?

> 
> What about that "toy" survey they had a while back? Could it be related to that?

Max said on his Twitter it was related to in-game stuff, though that could be *another* secret feature.

> 
> If we're finding out today, we should find out in about 20 minutes, that seems to be the usual time for posting weekly updates.

I think you are off by an hour. Typical Devnote Tuesday is somewhere around 17:00 CST, it's 16:00 now. Of course that doesn't guarantee anything, sometime it's earlier (very rarely), sometimes it's later (more common, as late as 19:00).

EDIT: and as luck would have it, it's early today. Probably the first time I've seen it before I left work.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-24T22:06:10Z" title="02/24/2015 10:06  PM" data-short="9 yr">February 24, 2015</time> by Alshain**
